trans-unit.source: Allows programmatic access to the HTML `<input type=hidden>` element on the server.
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control to embed information that is hidden from the user within a `<form>` element.
This information is sent when the Web page is posted back to the server.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control provides a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange> event that is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputControl.Value%2A> property changes values between posts to the server.
This allows you to create an event handler that performs a custom set of instructions each time the event is raised.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control does not provide a built-in way to post back to the server.

You must provide another control on the Web page that supports posting to the server, such as an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlButton> control, to send the value of the control back to the server.
The ASP.NET page framework uses this HTML feature to automatically load and persist the view state of server controls on a page.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden>.
Property
Initial Value
The "hidden" literal string.
Processes the postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.LoadPostData%2A> method checks to see whether the postback value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control is different from the previous value, and if so, returns `true`.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.LoadPostData%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> control's state has changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.OnPreRender%2A> method is called just prior to rendering the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.OnPreRender%2A> method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange"></xref> event.
This method allows you to handle the event directly.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputControl.Value%2A> property is changed on the server.
The control must have view state enabled for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange> event to work correctly.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [NIB: Raising an Event](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/f2adaf01-1ed1-42e1-8c31-8d467e7e0ee2).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.OnServerChange%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains event data.

Calls the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.OnServerChange(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method to signal the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> control that the state of the control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method is used primarily by control developers to extend the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden> control.
Renders the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> control's attributes to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputControl.Value"></xref> property is changed on the server.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputControl.Value%2A> property is changed between posts to the server.
The control must have view state enabled for the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.ServerChange> event to work correctly.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

Implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)"></xref> interface method by calling the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.LoadPostData(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)"></xref> method.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden"></xref> control's state has changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, `false`.

Implements the <xref href="System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent"></xref> interface method by calling the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputHidden.RaisePostDataChangedEvent"></xref> method.
